page.title: 09LONG ASHTON RIFLE RANGE
page.content: Through the village of Long Ashton, past the garage, lies a quarry. This is now used as a rifle range. This range is one of twenty-two clubs spread over England and Wales. Some of the rifles used are air rifles and .22 bore rifles. The targets are set at distances of 25 yards, 50 yards, 50 metres and 100 yards. These distances are measured exactly for safety reasons so the club can use the natural quarry wall. The competitions held on this ground are the Bristol and District Open, the Avon County Open and the Somerset Open and Closed. In an Open competition, anyone can take part, but only club members are allowed in a Closed event. One member of this club has a specially made rifle which cost him Â£1000, but most people pay around Â£250. Club members number between 15 and 50 people.
